1.text: In many parts, and many ways, God of old having spoken to the fathers in the prophets,

2.text: in these last days did speak to us in a Son, whom He appointed heir of all things, through whom also He did make the ages;

3.text: who being the brightness of the glory, and the impress of His subsistence, bearing up also the all things by the saying of his might—through himself having made a cleansing of our sins, sat down at the right hand of the greatness in the highest,

4.text: having become so much better than the messengers, as he did inherit a more excellent name than they.

5.text: For to which of the messengers said He ever, ‘My Son thou art—I to-day have begotten thee?’ and again, ‘I will be to him for a father, and he shall be to Me for a son?’

6.text: and when again He may bring in the first-born to the world, He saith, ‘And let them bow before him—all messengers of God;’

7.text: and unto the messengers, indeed, He saith, ‘Who is making His messengers spirits, and His ministers a flame of fire;’

8.text: and unto the Son: ‘Thy throne, O God, is to the age of the age; a sceptre of righteousness is the sceptre of thy reign;

9.text: thou didst love righteousness, and didst hate lawlessness; because of this did He anoint thee—God, thy God—with oil of gladness above thy partners;’

10.text: and, ‘Thou, at the beginning, Lord, the earth didst found, and a work of thy hands are the heavens;

11.text: these shall perish, and Thou dost remain, and all, as a garment, shall become old,

12.text: and as a mantle Thou shall roll them together, and they shall be changed, and Thou art the same, and Thy years shall not fail.’

13.text: And unto which of the messengers said He ever, ‘Sit at My right hand, till I may make thine enemies thy footstool?’

14.text: are they not all spirits of service—for ministration being sent forth because of those about to inherit salvation?
